Html:
When I add the missing reference to refered to below here:

Error 7 The type 'System.Windows.Input.ICommand' is defined in an assembly that is not referenced. You must add a reference to assembly 'PresentationCore, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35'. C:\Users\Edward\Documents\Visual Studio 2010Projects\MyDemoApplication\ModuleAProject\ViewModels\ModuleAViewOneViewModel.cs 33 21 ModuleAProject

 

I get a dialog box whith this new error:

"The Add Reference Dialog could not be shown due to the error:

Object reference not set to an instance of an object.

The error details have been saved to c:\Users\Edward\AppData\Local\Microsoft\VisualStudio\10.0\ShowAdddReferenceDialog.log

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This is the contents of the log file:

1/29/2011 7:53:30 PM
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.

Why am I getting such an error when all I'm doing is adding a reference to an Mcrosoft assembly? Also, the newly referenced assembly disappers when I close the error dialog box.  Any idea would be welcome!

Hi,

Since this is not a Prism related issue, you could find better support on Visual Studio Forums here.

In case you have installed Productivity Power Tools, you might find handy the following links:

  • Productivity Power Tools - Add Project Reference issue
  • Object reference not set to an instance of an object (Silverlight Forums)

I hope you find this links useful.

Thanks,

Miguel Bronzovic
http://blogs.southworks.net/mbronzovic
